column9: Normally, AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK) is a master regulator of cellular energy homeostasis that responds to changes in the ratio of [AMP] to [ATP]. The interaction of platelets with collagen fibrils exposed at the site of injury serve as a strong stimulus for platelet activation.
